event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

        Internal I/O consists of  SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD,
        and PCI-Express slots 0, 1, 2, and 3.

        All I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured.

        If this is PCIe switch chip 0, then built-in disks, built-in GbE, built-in DVD drive,
        and the first PCIe slot are deconfigured.

        If this is PCIe switch chip 1, then the second, third, and fourth PCIe slots are deconfigured.

        The entire platform is reset.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

    
         Domain associated with the PCI-X slot and the internal I/O is reset.

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the domain resets.
         
         If this is PCIe switch chip on an IOU,  then all the built-in IO behind the PCIe switch chip is
         deconfigured (built-in disks, built-in GbE, built-in DVD drive, built-in tape drive, PCI-X slot,
         and the first PCIe slot).



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

    
         Domain associated with the PCI-X slot and the internal I/O is reset.

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the domain resets.
         
          If this is PCIe switch chip on an IOU,  then all the built-in IO behind the PCIe switch chip is
         deconfigured (built-in disks, built-in GbE, built-in DVD drive, built-in tape drive, PCI-X slot,
         and the first PCIe slot)..



   External IO Expansion Unit (IOX):

      
         Domain using the PCIe switch chip on one boat of an External IO Expansion Unit is reset.

         All PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots on one boat of an External IO Expansion Unit
         are deconfigured after the domain resets.

         The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform power cycles
         or across Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:09:46 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: e81e6870-fedd-4306-a198-8ef47ff91d70
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8001-U5 for detailed information.
   

   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-U5, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:09:46 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: e81e6870-fedd-4306-a198-8ef47ff91d70
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8001-U5 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip
   is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are
   deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat).
   IMPACT: The domain using the PCIe switch chip is reset.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u e81e6870-fedd-4306-a198-8ef47ff91d70

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:09:46.5336 e81e6870-fedd-4306-a198-8ef47ff91d70 SCF-8001-U5
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pciex.switch.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_sw=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_sw=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain using the PCIe switch chip is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: All internal I/O behind the PCIe switch chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an IOU) or all the PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are deconfigured (if the PCIe switch chip is located on an I/O Boat).
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error was detected within a PCIe switch chip.
